Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: கற்றாருள் கற்றார் எனப்படுவர் கற்றார்முன் கற்ற செலச்சொல்லு வார்.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: Those who can agreeably set forth their acquirements before the learned will be regarded as the most learned among the learned.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A scholar is speaking before an assembly of other, highly esteemed scholars ('கற்றார் முன்').
Layered_Composition.Midground: The speaker is not just reciting facts. They are skillfully and pleasingly presenting what they have learned ('கற்ற செலச்சொல்லுவார்'), visualized as weaving the raw threads of knowledge into a beautiful, intricate, and luminous tapestry.
Layered_Composition.Background: The other scholars are looking on with expressions of deep admiration and respect. Above the speaker's head, a second, more brilliant laurel wreath appears, signifying that they are being recognized as the 'most learned among the learned' ('கற்றாருள் கற்றார்').

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: To be able to articulate one's knowledge effectively before an audience of one's peers is the mark of the highest level of scholarship.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The weaving of the luminous tapestry is a metaphor for eloquent and skillful presentation. The second, brighter laurel wreath symbolizes the highest honor.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: A warm, intelligent, scholarly light. The tapestry of knowledge glows with a brilliant, golden light, impressing the audience.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A shot that focuses on the speaker and their 'tapestry of words', while also capturing the admiring reactions of the other scholars.
Technical_Cues.Art_Genre: Historical realism, with fantasy elements for the tapestry.

Cultural_Anchors: The most learned among the learned ('கற்றாருள் கற்றார்')
Speaking well before the learned ('கற்றார் முன் செலச்சொல்லுவார்')
